headline.main: White House Takes Steps To Renew Tie To Hollywood
headline.kicker: A NATION CHALLENGED: THE FILM INDUSTRY

lead_paragraph: Several dozen top Hollywood executives are to meet for two hours on Sunday morning with Karl Rove, President Bush's senior adviser, to try to find common ground on how the entertainment industry can contribute to the war effort, replicating in spirit if not in scope the partnership formed between filmmakers and war planners in the 1940's. It is not only a different world than Hollywood and Washington faced in the opening months of World War II, it is also a radically different entertainment industry.
abstract: Several dozen top Hollywood executives are set to meet with Karl Rove, Pres Bush's senior adviser, to try to find common ground on how entertainment industry can contribute to war effort, replicating in spirit if not in scope the partnership formed between filmmakers and war planners in 1940's; conflict provides opportunity for studios to reassert their patriotism and perhaps quiet some of anti-Hollywood clamor among conservative elements of country, and it could also be good business (M)
